TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content: Alone as final word, alone = Val is going to force the M7 onto a suborbital trajectory or something evil like that
You all just been read'n too much of that plan kappa drama she's probably just lonely. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> You all just been read'n too much of that plan kappa drama she's probably just lonely. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

A bad plan to be prepared, it never is.

Val is actually Fabien then...

PLOT TWIST!

> 
> A bad plan to be prepared, it never is.

Alright Yoda. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

 Someone's been sitting on KSPO too long ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Glad to see that fore*shortening* the Klaw in that image increased the fore*boding* ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) As to what's up with Val: if you think you've seen that exact image of her before you're not wrong. I did not use a recent screenshot for it.
Bill breaks the fourth wall!

> 
> Glad to see that fore*shortening* the Klaw in that image increased the fore*boding* ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) As to what's up with Val: if you think you've seen that exact image of her before you're not wrong. I did not use a recent screenshot for it.

Now that you mention it, that picture looks a lot like the one from Val's final monologue in Duna, Ore Bust.

So close to launch, just a few things to do first...

![RWMny3E.png](http://i.imgur.com/RWMny3E.png)

![n68dZ5C.png](http://i.imgur.com/n68dZ5C.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-22T13:44:33Z" title="10/22/2015 01:44  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 22, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**
Radioactive seat? Well ok, at least the children will be a surprise. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Bill is the Neo of the Kerbal Matrix.

> 
> Bill is the Neo of the Kerbal Matrix.

"You put on the blue suit, or the yellow suit, or the green suit, the story ends. You wake up in your cockpit and believe whatever you want to believe. You put on the red suit, you stay in persistenceland, and I show you how deep the mohole goes."

> 
> "You put on the blue suit, or the yellow suit, or the green suit, the story ends. You wake up in your cockpit and believe whatever you want to believe. You put on the red suit, you stay in persistenceland, and I show you how deep the mohole goes."

Conducting some DPA testing to find out how far a quote can be streched, are we? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> "You put on the blue suit, or the yellow suit, or the green suit, the story ends. You wake up in your cockpit and believe whatever you want to believe. You put on the red suit, you stay in persistenceland, and I show you how deep the mohole goes."

I definitely think we need different-coloured spacesuits (or at least helmets) for the three types of Kerbonaut- blue for scientists, yellow for engineers and red for pilots. The last two could be reversed if you prefer Jim Kerman to Jean-Luc Kerman ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> I definitely think we need different-coloured spacesuits (or at least helmets) for the three types of Kerbonaut- blue for scientists, yellow for engineers and red for pilots. The last two could be reversed if you prefer Jim Kerman to Jean-Luc Kerman ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Actually those exist; GregroxMun made a nice set, and there are others. I'm working on a Kerbfleet version myself for the next story. But color alone *still* might not be enough, especially if by chance your landing party consists of all males or all females:

![D62Yq40.png](http://i.imgur.com/D62Yq40.png)

PS yes this page is canon, #8.18.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-22T15:06:09Z" title="10/22/2015 03:06  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 22, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**

> 
> "You put on the blue suit, or the yellow suit, or the green suit, the story ends. You wake up in your cockpit and believe whatever you want to believe. You put on the red suit, you stay in persistenceland, and I show you how deep the mohole goes."

I so wanted to rep you for this. Darned forum software anyway.

I guess you couldn't parkour up to the hatch. Well, you had to do something. After all, you couldn't leave all that hard-won science behind. Bob would never forgive you. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Happy landings!

> 
> I guess you couldn't parkour up to the hatch.

I did try--that's how Jeb ended up hanging from the Billmobile landing gear by his ankle.

And yeah, I did *completely* forget about the science when designing the two ships: I guess my only concern--like Bill's--was getting everyone off the surface, and I knew I could do that with a crew transfer. Tho it begs the question of exactly where the Jeffries tubes run through the M7's structure: I mean, you'd have to go through the landing gear into a Mammoth engine, then up the Kerbodyne tanks, and then I guess squeeze through either a strut or a fuel duct to get to the core section--yeah, maybe better not to think about it.

So since I did release page 18 a bit early now you all know what the soundtrack will be for next update...

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/U4WiyxXpyZc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Did Jeb just try to make someone else pilot a huge rocket while he sits in the back?

Doesn't sound like him. Did he fall on his head? Ah, yes, and in Eve's gravity.

> 
> Tho it begs the question of exactly where the Jeffries tubes run through the M7's structure: I mean, you'd have to go through the landing gear into a Mammoth engine, then up the Kerbodyne tanks, and then I guess squeeze through either a strut or a fuel duct to get to the core section--yeah, maybe better not to think about it.

I've wondered about that, too. My theory is that they do an Elastigirl thing (or Mr. Fantastic, if you prefer) and squeeze themselves through the tiniest ducts when needed. That could also explain their amazing resistance to G-forces.

Happy landings!

Hum, this means that Bill is either Neo, Agent Smith or Cypher ( the only ones in the Matrix movie(s ... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) that could enter or get out of the Matrix at will ) ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I just wonder which one ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) ...

On the squeeziness part ... well, it was not already established that kerbals were made of fuel? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) ( atleast is what the good ol'Karbonite mod says ... )
I'm still wondering why Val sent the B-team guy away. The M7 doesn't have drills and a converter, right? Otherwise I'd believe they aren't planning to return to Kerbin at all.

> 
> (snippity snip that magic carpet ride)

Too bad the M7 has no warp drive ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Val is Agent Smith then.

> 
> "You put on the blue suit, or the yellow suit, or the green suit, the story ends. You wake up in your cockpit and believe whatever you want to believe. You put on the red suit, you stay in persistenceland, and I show you how deep the mohole goes."

There is no Mohole
I'm sorry I couldn't rep you for the last page. Loving the comic, as always!
